rsbNotes.title: Pr 1:24
rsbNotes.text: 1:24 you refused. The rejection of wisdom’s evangel has its parallels in the rejection of God’s grace by Israel.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 1:25
rsbNotes.text: 1:25 counsel. Here wisdom speaks with full authority. As God’s counsel, her counsel and advice is not open to debate (2:6; 8:14).

rsbNotes.title: Pr 1:28
rsbNotes.text: 1:28 I will not answer. True wisdom is an aspect of God’s saving grace, and there comes a point of no return for those who reject it. This truth reinforces the urgency of the message. No one can expect God’s favor and at the same time scorn the gifts He offers (Deut. 1:45; 1 Sam. 28:6; Ps. 18:41).
